item.title: Godzilla Is Finally Stomping His Way Back Into Console Games, But It'll Be A While
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/godzilla-is-finally-stomping-his-way-back-into-console-games-but-itll-be-a-while/1100-6530913/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The last couple of years have seen several well-received Godzilla movies released, and parent company Toho is looking to grow that success beyond the silver screen. The Japanese studio has announced that it will invest $830 million in new games, anime, and other projects based on its IP, including Godzilla console games.

Toho plans to spend $490 million on content development alone, which will focus on a broad range of media as it pivots toward growing its brand overseas (via Bloomberg). In addition to an undefined number of Godzilla console games, the studio will also focus on animation, theme park attractions, and mobile games as part of its brand expansion strategy.

While Godzilla appeared in numerous video games over the decades, the last couple of years have seen the kaiju king relegated to crossovers and cameos. Games like Fall Guys have offered Godzilla cosmetics to players, while Call of Duty: Warzone featured Godzilla as an environmental hazard and enemy as part of its Operation Monarch event.

Recently, Godzilla has starred in several mobile games--and a turn-based strategy game heavily inspired by Into the Breach in 2022 called Godzilla: Voxel Wars--but the last big game featuring the titan was 2014's Godzilla for the PS4, which was later released in Europe and the US in 2015. That game was met with negative reception upon release, and it has an average critic score of 38 on GameSpot sister site Metacritic.

"Godzilla commits so many game design sins that they become impossible to count, but the greatest horror of them all is that such giant monsters could be so boring," Kevin VanOrd wrote in GameSpot's Godzilla review, scoring the game 3/10.

While it'll be a long time before Godzilla stomps his way back onto consoles, the cinematic future of the King of the Monsters looks bright. As mentioned above, a sequel to the Oscar-winning Godzilla Minus One is in development, and Legendary Pictures' Monsterverse will see the Godzilla and King Kong franchises team up for a third time in a movie that is scheduled to be released on March 26, 2027.

Darryn Bonthuys on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: The GeForce RTX 5060 Ti Launches Today, But It's Already Selling Out Fast
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/the-geforce-rtx-5060-ti-launches-today-but-its-already-selling-out-fast/1100-6530910/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Nvidia has been rolling out its RTX 50-Series graphics cards over the past few months, and today marks the arrival of the GeForce RTX 5060 Ti. Available in 8GB ($379) and 16GB ($429) formats, early reviews are calling it a solid addition to the Nvidia catalog and worth considering if you’re seeking a versatile mid-range card. Unsurprisingly, the new RTX 5060 Ti is a hot commodity, with retailers already selling out, though new stock is likely to return soon. To help track availability, we’ve put together a short list of major retailers most likely to have the RTX 5060 Ti in stock. Even if the GPU is sold out, be sure to keep checking the links below periodically to see if it's back in stock.

Nvidia RTX 5060 Ti Restock Tracker

  • Check stock at Best Buy
  • Check stock at Amazon
  • Check stock at Walmart
  • Check stock at Newegg
  • Check stock at Antonline

Like other RTX 50-Series GPUS, the RTX 5060 lineup features Nvidia's new Blackwell architecture, offering DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation, Nvidia Reflex 2 for added responsiveness, and full ray tracing with neural rendering. The end result is faster performance than its predecessor and the ability to upscale lower resolutions to 1440p and 4K resolutions. According to Nvidia, the RTX 5060 Ti offers double the performance of the old RTX 4060 Ti when DLSS 4 is enabled (it's worth noting that the RTX 5060 Ti's performance uplift over the 4060 Ti without DLSS 4 is closer to about 15% faster). You’ll find the GPUs to be much slimmer than the RTX 4060 lineup, too, thanks to AI technology that allows the hardware to hit better benchmarks without requiring the same raw horsepower.

A variety of 5060 Ti models (including overclocked variants) are available from third parties. Here’s a look at some of the top models offered at Best Buy.

Nvidia GeForce RTX 5060 Ti Models

  • Asus Prime Nvidia GeForce RTX 5060 Ti (8GB) -- $420
  • Asus Prime Nvidia GeForce RTX 5060 Ti (16GB) -- $480
  • Asus Prime Nvidia GeForce RTX 5060 Ti OC Edition (8GB) -- $470
  • Asus Prime Nvidia GeForce RTX 5060 Ti OC Edition (16GB) -- $530
  • Asus TUF Gaming Nvidia GeForce RTX 5060 Ti OC Edition (8GB) -- $540
  • Asus TUF Gaming Nvidia GeForce RTX 5060 Ti OC Edition (16GB) -- $600

It's worth noting that the standard GeForce RTX 5060 is expected to arrive next month for $299, and you’ll also find RTX 5060 laptops in May, with prices starting at $1,099. So if you’re interested in a new GPU or gaming laptop but can't afford (or can't find) the 5060 Ti or any of the other GeForce RTX 50-Series Graphics Cards, you'll only have to wait a few more weeks for the standard RTX 5060 to launch. While the RTX 5060 will be less powerful compared to the 5060 Ti, it'll still sport all the beneficial AI-powered frame generation and upscaling thanks to DLSS 4, and will be one of the most affordable RTX 50-Series GPUs..

item.title: Looks Like Cody Rhodes And The Undertaker Are The Next WWE Fortnite Skins
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/looks-like-cody-rhodes-and-the-undertaker-are-the-next-wwe-fortnite-skins/1100-6530911/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fortnite has been advertising heavily during WWE events this year despite the fact that there hasn't been any real WWE presence in the game in a while, leading pretty much everyone to assume a new collab was on the way. And it turns out that assumption was right, as reputable leakers are reporting that Cody Rhodes and The Undertaker will be the next wrestlers to be immortalized as Fortnite skins.

This isn't one of those not-so-credible "I'm hearing this is might happen sometime in the next few years" leaks like last week's Jack Black and Kingdom Come: Deliverance rumors. No, this leak comes with a release date (Friday) and prices (2800 V-Bucks for the full bundle), and was reported by multiple different sources simultaneously--it's quite credible.

In addition to the Cody Rhodes and Undertaker outfits, the set will include the Undertaker's urn and the American Nightmare mantle back blings, along with the Cody's Cutlass and Taker's Shovel pickaxes, an American Nightmare wrap, and emotes for both Cody Rhodes and Undertaker. The whole set will be included in a bundle for 2800 V-Bucks, and every item can be purchased separately if you only want a specific item or two. We don't have images for any of this yet--these items will be decrypted on Thursday afternoon.

This set represents the third wave of WWE collaborations with Fortnite. The first added John Cena all by his lonesome back in 2022, and then a year later we got Bianca Belair and Becky Lynch as well. The expansion of WWE's roster into Fortnite then paused until this week.

Fortnite has been overflowing with collaborations in 2025, starting in January with Hatsune Miku and Godzilla x Kong, and continuing with new skins from Kaiju No. 8, Jujutsu Kaisen, James Cameron's Avatar, Mortal Kombat, Cowboy Bebop, Invincible (including a free Dupli-Kate), Tomb Raider, Walking Dead, and Adventure Time--not to mention Sabrina Carpenter, Shohei Ohtani, and Clix joining the Icon Series. All this--plus these new WWE skins and a rumored Star Wars season on the horizon in May--make it seem as if these collabs are not slowing down even a little bit.

Phil Owen on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Marathon Alpha Requirements And Minimum PC Specs Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/marathon-alpha-requirements-and-minimum-pc-specs-revealed/1100-6530908/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Bungie has revealed the closed alpha test requirements and PC specs for Marathon, its upcoming shooter game. The test will be conducted across PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC in North America from April 23 to May 4.

In order to qualify for the alpha test, players will need to join the official Marathon Discord channel and Bungie will invite selected participants. The lucky winners need to be located in North America, be 18 years old or older, have access to a PS5, Xbox Series X|S, or PC, and have a Bungie.net account in good standing.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Marathon - Announce Trailer | PS5 & PC Games

The alpha test requires all players to have a Bungie.net account, and presumably the full release will, as well. A PlayStation Plus or Xbox Live account is not required to play the alpha test, but will be once Marathon officially launches. Friend invites are not supported during the alpha, although friends will be able to group up with each other if they were selected participants.

The alpha is approximately 6GB and only supports the English language. However, Bungie plans on supporting the full game with many additional languages. Additionally, account progress from the alpha will be deleted from test servers when they're closed and will not be saved for launch.

Marathon launches on September 23, and will support both cross-play and cross-save. While Marathon won't be full price, it'll be a premium title, with reports that it'll be $40. In GameSpot's Marathon preview, we said, "Marathon feels like it'll deliver satisfying gameplay, but the experience around it could leave a lot to be desired."

Marathon Closed Alpha Test PC Specs

Minimum

  • Processor: Intel Core i5-6600 / AMD Ryzen 5 2600
  • Memory: 8GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 Ti (4GB) / AMD Radeon RX 5500 XT (4GB) / Intel Arc A580 (8GB)
  • Video Memory (VRAM): 4GB
  • DirectX: DirectX 12 with Feature Level 12_1 support
  • Operating System: Windows 10 64-bit (latest Service Pack)
George Yang on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
